page.title: 02THE SCHOOL INSPECTOR
page.content: Schools in the last century were the subject of continuous Inspection. As the Primary School was a Methodist Institution, the Inspector was usually a Clergyman. There are frequent references in the Log Books of the school to visits made by one Rev George French. His main interest was the TOILETS. There is an entry made in 1877 which reads "I regret to say that I cannot regard the office accommodation here as satisfactory either in quality or position. In the boy's one office several can sit side by side and the door leading to it is directly infront of the Girl's part of the playground. There was an unpleasant smell from the Girl's place and some unhealthy liquid was making its way through the wall into the yard."
